"It's been about a week."  The blue-and-black femme props her head in 
her hands.  "Most of the crew is down - it's getting to be a real 
pain.  Especially now that we're being pulled into the local 
conflict.  By the way, Lunara's formal career ended about ten years 
ago, so a lot of people don't remember her that well."

A beeping tone alerts her to the return of the strike force.  "Oh, 
excuse me."  She hops down and darts out of the room.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil: The name sounds familiar, but I've been stationed for a 
bit 
> on a fringe world, so I might not know her very good. How long has 
she 
> been in stasis lock?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > "Well, you might remember my sister, Lunara - one of the best 
> Maximal 
> > entertainers there ever was.  She choreographed all her own 
> > routines.  I was her assistant - and I still am, or would be if 
she 
> > wasn't in stasis lock because of that energy storm we ran 
into ..." 
> > Jayde trails off, obviously upset over her older sibling's 
> condition.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Yggdrasil slightly bent his head and thought.
> > > 
> > > Yggdrasil: I can't deny that. What did you do before joining 
the 
> > > rogues?
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > "I've been on missions before - including solos." she points 
> > > > out.  "The fact that I'm still alive and free after all the 
run-
> > ins 
> > > > we've had with the law should tell you something."
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Yggdrasil: I'm not saying you're a rookie, just that rookie 
> get 
> > > > killed 
> > > > > with that attitude. Besides, you won't convince me you're a 
> > > > military 
> > > > > expert just by saying so. You'll have to prove it.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > Jayde sits bolt upright and glares at him.  "ROOKIES?  
I've 
> > been 
> > > > > with 
> > > > > > this outfit for almost ten years!"
> > > > > >

lots 
> > of 
> > > > > > rookies 
> > > > > > > saying the same things you say and getting scrapped at 
the 
> > > > first 
> > > > > > > occasion they get. The good thing is it separates those
